title: Piltover Trade Map, I Have So Many Questions

embed.description: Piltover is a thriving, progressive city whose power and influence is on the rise. It is Valoran's cultural center, where art, craftsmanship, trade and innovation walk hand in hand.

body:
1. Who are the purple footed men/women in Bilgewater and why should or should not I buy from them?
2. How does currency work on Runeterra can I buy Piltover goods with Silver Serpents?
3.Why are Noxians not allowed in Palclyff?
4. How is Noxus pushing into Shurima now that Azir has returned?
5. Why are Avarosians in Frostheld paying double?
6.  Is clockwise truly lucky?
7. Why are people at The Drakengate using Ionian silver as an Adulterant ?
8. How badly does the Black Mist affect trade?
9. Is Piltover a neutral region,do they have allies or do they trade with everyone?
10. Why does Demacian moons make fools out of young lovers?

replies.body:
I can give clues for a few of these.

1. Because it's evidence of underhandedness.  Or underfootedness, if you like.
2. There's actually another currency clue in there to find.  Good luck!
3. Maybe you want to ask S.D. that.
4. Because they need the grain.
5. I swear by it, certainly.
6. 'Ionian Silver' _pomace_, actually.  Honey fruit seeds are so last year.
7. Increasingly.
8. Trade agreements are generally on a per family basis.  But some places turn away everyone.
9. Strange sounding phrase, isn't it.  Very _uncommon_, and unlikely to turn up in normal conversation.
I just realized, with number 9, that phrase is a password isn't it? to make secret trades with demacians?

anyone know the difference between the red sea routes and the chalky black ones?

Actually, the red ones are older, more established and well-known. That's why they're closer to Piltover, it being the reference point. The charcoal ones are routes that Jago must've been less sure of, as he's expanding his reach outward and learning as he goes.
O.o more importantly, where is Zaun???????
Zuan to my knowledge is under Piltover, Piltover is situated on clifts and is elevated and Zaun is under it
Oh wow, I thought they were neighboring cities.... which pretty much is still true but for map's sakes it's incredibly totalitarian D:
They use to be neighboring cites but that got retconned to this recently

There's a manmade water passage between the cliffs that piltover sits on top of- that's how they get all their trade that's made them so rich. Zaun is built into those cliffs, while piltover sits on top of the cliffs. They used to be one city.

I find it incredibly interesting because the scale of the city must be so big that there is people who is born in Piltover and they never set foot on Zaun, the contrary is also possible even though, young zaunites can't help but look up and see the city that has begrudge them while young piltovians probably don't even bother looking down... incredibly rich stories right there
I'm very interested in the picture of what appears to be a Minotaur blacksmith in "Krexor", northeast of Piltover.  Is Alistar not alone anymore?
Well, he's never been "alone", even in the old retconned lore, he was part of a tribe of minotaurs. His tribe might've been destroyed but there is most likely a bunch more.
